title: Lewknor Walks Walking Route

images.title: David Hawgood / Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve
images.caption: Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve. View from the top of the Chilterns scarp near Upper Vicar's Farm. The gate is the top of the footpath down to Hill farm, whose buildings are visible. To the right of the buildings is the M40 at its junction with the B4009 - a great transport interchange point, with coaches to central London. Beyond is the Oxford plain.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Aston Rowant Nature Reserve
images.caption: Aston Rowant Nature Reserve. Showing two of a succession of spurs that run characterise the Chiltern scarp. The second one here is Beacon Hill. The first is unnamed. The M40 is seen towards the left. It comes this side of Beacon Hill.

images.title: David Hawgood / Bald Hill, Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve
images.caption: Bald Hill, Aston Rowant National Nature Reserve. Beech woods at the top, juniper scrub on the chalk grassland of the Chilterns scarp

description: This small Chilterns village is located just south of Thame in the county of Oxfordshire. The pretty settlement is known for its historic 14th century church of St Margaret's, it's photogenic old flint cottages and a rather fine 17th century pub. It has been used as a filming location for the popular TV series Midsomer Murders. Local options for walkers include the Aston Rowant Nature Reserve and The Ridgeway National Trail which can be picked up just to the south of the settlement. This circular walk explores the reserve which includes peaceful woodland paths and a hill climb to Beacon Hill. On the way you can look out for a variety of wildlife and enjoy some glorious views of the surrounding Chilterns Hills.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Leathern Bottle is a pub of some note dating back to the 1600s. The Grade II listed pub serves good quality food and includes a splendid large garden area to relax in on warm summer days. They have a large car park so the pub makes a good start point for a walk in the area.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and country trails are ideal for dog walking. The local pub mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: Hill Road, Lewknor, South Oxfordshire, Oxfordshire, England, OX49 5TS, United Kingdom
